title: Learning Analytics-Based Personalized Language Education Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and job-related language application experience
context.additional_context: Smartphone-centric workplace language instruction for professionals in limited-technology contexts

learning_goals: Within four weeks, learners analyze corporate language learning activity data (quiz scores ≥80%, pronunciation ≥Level 2 on a 3-point scale, participation ≥70%) to classify the language proficiency (beginner/intermediate/advanced) of ten learners and design three or more personalized feedback strategies (2 recommended additional learning materials, 1 focused training topic, 1 real-time coaching request) per proficiency level.

Learners propose three or more improvement plans by maintaining ≥80% participation in corporate language programs, achieving ≥75% task completion rates, and analyzing assessment result patterns using evidence-based approaches (data visualization, statistical analysis).

Within four weeks, learners analyze provided learning analytics data (3 video segments with <70% viewership, 2 text materials with <50% completion, 2 discussion topics in the bottom 20% participation) to establish two or more optimization strategies (content length adjustment, interactive elements addition) for blended learning materials (video, text, discussion) and receive a feasibility score of 4 or higher (5-point scale) from supervisors.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
